Hi Elias,

Apologies—looks like I forgot to attach the files in my last message.

Here are the HTML files for the email signatures. You can open the one you need in your browser, copy the full content, and paste it into your email service’s signature settings.

And just a reminder, if you’d like a step-by-step walkthrough, we’ve also got a short tutorial video ready to go. Happy to send that through again if needed!

Let me know if you have any questions or need help with setup.
(Time: 35 min)

Hi Elias,

Thanks again for your feedback, really glad the signatures are looking good on your end!

Included here are the HTML files for each email signature. You’ll just need to open the one you need, copy the content, and paste it directly into your email client’s signature settings (like Gmail, Outlook, etc).

Here’s a quick summary of the setup:
  1. Open the signature file in your browser
  2. Highlight and copy the full signature
  3. Paste it into your email service’s signature section
  4. Save your changes and you’re all set

If you'd prefer a step-by-step walkthrough, we’ve also put together a short video that shows the full process and confirms that everything is working as expected.
  • Email Signature Testing & Tutorial | Comet Waste Management
  • Email Signature Files | Comet Waste

Let me know if you run into any issues or need a hand with anything—always happy to help.

If there’s anything else you need in the meantime, just let me know—always happy to help.
